intro: Calyptranthera villosa, commonly known as the hairy calyptranthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Calyptranthera villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
